pageContext.title: These are the 10 most active venture capital firms in Southeast Asia
pageContext.content:
This list includes the 10 investors that have made the most deals in Southeast Asian startups from 2017 to October 2018, including firms that have funded series A and B rounds within the same period.

Jungle Ventures founding partners Anurag Srivastava (L) and Amit Anand (R) / Photo credit: Jungle Ventures

Three years ago, Tech in Asia published a list of the 36 most active startup investment firms in Southeast Asia. The startup funding landscape has changed significantly since then.

Using our own data, we’ve noted down the 10 investors that have made the most deals in Southeast Asian startups from 2017 to October 2018, including firms that have funded series A and B rounds within the same period.

Tech in Asia‘s database mostly includes deals that have been covered by the media. If you’d like to help us complete missing information, please reach out at research@techinasia.com.

500 Startups

500 Startups calls itself a new kind of seed fund and startup accelerator. It believes that successful internet startups are born from usable design, customer-focused metrics, and online distribution.

Funding focus: Seed; Series A

Recent investees:
Carousell
Base.vn
FinAccel

Countries where it has investments: Cambodia, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam

Total number of deals: 41

East Ventures

East Venture’s Willson Cuaca / Photo credit: East Ventures

The firm aims to bring success to ventures by providing early-stage seed capital to promising startups. With a total of six offices in Jakarta, Tokyo, and San Francisco, East Ventures has invested in over 150 companies across Asia and the US.

Funding focus: Seed; Series A

Recent investees:
WareSix
Fore
Bahasa.ai

Countries where it has investments: Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore

Total number of deals: 33

Sequoia Capital

Shailendra Singh (L), Sequoia Capital India’s managing director, with TIA’s David Corbin (R)

Sequoia Capital helps founders turn imaginative ideas into enduring companies. As the “entrepreneurs behind the entrepreneurs,” the company has worked closely with top founders such as Steve Jobs of Apple, Larry Ellison of Oracle, Len Bosack and Sandy Lerner of Cisco, David Filo and Jerry Yang of Yahoo, Max Levchin, Elon Musk, and Peter Thiel of PayPal, and many more. Sequoia aims to help the next generation of innovators build the lasting companies of tomorrow.

Funding focus: Series A, B, C and D

Recent investees:
One Championship
PatSnap
Moka

Countries where it has investments: Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore

Total number of deals: 16

Wavemaker Partners

Wavemaker Partners is a member of the Draper Venture Network, a global venture capital collective with 10 funds spread across four continents.

Recent investees:
Sprout Solutions
Kyklo
Jumper.ai

Funding focus: Seed; Series A and B

Countries where it has investments: Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand

Total number of deals: 14

Insignia Ventures Partners

Insignia Venture Partners founder Yinglan Tan

Insignia Ventures Partners is an early-stage technology venture capital firm that primarily targets Southeast Asia. The Singapore-headquartered company was founded by Tan Yinglan, former venture partner at Sequoia Capital.

Recent investees:
First Circle
Logivan
Warung Pintar

Funding focus: Seed; Series A

Countries where it has investments: Indonesia, Singapore, Vietnam

Total number of deals: 12

Convergence Ventures

Adrian Li, founder and managing partner of Convergence Ventures

Convergence Ventures is an early-stage technology fund that zeroes in on Indonesia investments.

Recent investees:
Moka
KoinWorks
Zuzu Hospitality Solutions

Funding focus: Seed; Series A

Countries invested in: Indonesia, Singapore

Total number of deals: 12

Golden Gate Ventures

Jeffrey Paine of Golden Gate Ventures / Photo credit: SunBridge Global Ventures

Golden Gate Ventures sets its sights on companies building out consumer internet products and services for Southeast Asia. It prefers companies with a launched product (even in stealth mode) or that have established valuable distribution partnerships in the region.

Recent investees:
Rovo
Homage
Carro

Funding focus: Seed; Series A, B, and C

Countries where it has investments: Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand

Total number of deals: 12

Alpha JWC Ventures

Image courtesy of Alpha JWC

With its strong Indonesia focus, Alpha JWC Ventures is sector-agnostic and invests in early- to growth-stage technology companies.

Recent investees:
Lemonilo
Kredivo
Carro

Funding focus: Seed; Series A and B

Countries where it has investments: Indonesia, Singapore

Total number of deals: 11

MDI Ventures

Image courtesy of MDI Ventures

This Jakarta-based firm is the corporate venture capital arm of Telkom Indonesia. MDI Ventures has operations in Singapore and Silicon Valley.

Recent investees:
Kredivo
Anchanto
aCommerce

Funding focus: Seed; Series A, B, and C

Countries where it has investments: Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand

Total number of deals: 10

Jungle Ventures

Jungle Ventures founding partners Anurag Srivastava (L) and Amit Anand (R) / Photo credit: Jungle Ventures

The Singapore-based, entrepreneur-backed firm funds and helps startups scale across Asia Pacific. Jungle Ventures invests in global startups that solves problems relevant to the region’s markets.

Recent investees:
Kredivo
RedDoorz
Crayon Data

Funding focus: Series A and B

Countries where it has investments: Singapore, Indonesia, Thailand, Malaysia, India, US

Total number of deals: 9

seo.title: The top 10 venture capital firms in Southeast Asia (and where they invest)
seo.description: The 10 investment firms with the most deals in Southeast Asian startups from 2017 to October 2018.
